page.title: 07ROSSENDALE ATHLETIC CLUB
page.content: Rossendale Athletic Club was formed in November 1967,following a public meeting convened by Rawtenstall Sports Federation. A running track and pavilion were built at Central Playing Fields,Marl Pits,now the Club's headquarters. The Club's colours are light blue vests with a dark blue/white/dark blue diagonal stripe,and the club badge is a stag surrounded by the club name. The club now has a mens and ladies section,the former having renamed to Rossendale Harriers & A.C. The club competes in track & field athletics,road,cross-country and fell racing. To date the Club's most outstanding runner is international David Lewis, who in 1985 has become the senior National Cross-Country Champion,AAA 3000m indoor and AAA 5000m champion.
